intro: Rotheca myricoides f. lanceolatilobata, commonly known as the lanceolate-lobed rotheca, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with distinct lobes, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed in horticulture.
